law.catch_line: Administration During Minority Of Named Executor
law.text: [ Text of section effective until March 31, 2012. Repealed by 2008, 521, Sec. 13. See 2008, 521, Sec. 44 as amended by 2010, 409, Sec. 23 and 2011, 224.] If a person named as executor is a minor at the time of the probate of the will, administration with the will annexed may be granted during his minority, unless there is another executor who accepts the trust.
